item.title: Rethinking LLM Human Simulation: When a Graph is What You Need
item.description: arXiv:2511.02135v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly used to simulate humans, with applications ranging from survey prediction to decision-making. However, are LLMs strictly necessary, or can smaller, domain-grounded models suffice? We identify a large class...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, LLM, RAG, model, large language model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Let Multimodal Embedders Learn When to Augment Query via Adaptive Query Augmentation
item.description: arXiv:2511.02358v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Query augmentation makes queries more meaningful by appending further information to the queries to find relevant documents. Current studies have proposed Large Language Model (LLM)-based embedders, which learn representation for embedding and generat...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, LLM, multimodal, RAG, experiment | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Graph-Attentive MAPPO for Dynamic Retail Pricing
item.description: arXiv:2511.00039v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Dynamic pricing in retail requires policies that adapt to shifting demand while coordinating decisions across related products. We present a systematic empirical study of multi-agent reinforcement learning for retail price optimization, comparing a st...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> attention, arxiv, study, RAG, product | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Better Call CLAUSE: A Discrepancy Benchmark for Auditing LLMs Legal Reasoning Capabilities
item.description: arXiv:2511.00340v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The rapid integration of large language models (LLMs) into high-stakes legal work has exposed a critical gap: no benchmark exists to systematically stress-test their reliability against the nuanced, adversarial, and often subtle flaws present in real-...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, study, LLM, reasoning, API | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Retrieval-Augmented Multimodal Depression Detection
item.description: arXiv:2511.01892v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multimodal deep learning has shown promise in depression detection by integrating text, audio, and video signals. Recent work leverages sentiment analysis to enhance emotional understanding, yet suffers from high computational cost, domain mismatch, a...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, framework, LLM, multimodal, analysis | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Superpositional Gradient Descent: Harnessing Quantum Principles for Model Training
item.description: arXiv:2511.01918v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly trained with classical optimization techniques like AdamW to improve convergence and generalization. item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> vector, framework, LLM, reasoning, knowledge base | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
